intro: Protium icicariba, commonly known as the Caribbean silk tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and parks.
